intro: Cyrtandra heinrichii, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky areas. Cyrtandra heinrichii is an important component of Hawaii's endemic flora and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of the islands. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of the region.
